g1.definition: [Α] of Hebrew origin; the first letter of the alphabet; figuratively, only (from its use as a numeral) the first:  Often used (usually ἄν, before a vowel) also in composition (as a contraction from {{g427}}) in the sense of privation; so, in many words, beginning with this letter; occasionally in the sense of union (as a contraction of {{g260}}).

g2.definition: [Ἀαρών] of Hebrew origin ({{h175}}); Aaron, the brother of Moses

g3.definition: [Ἀβαδδών] of Hebrew origin ({{h11}}); a destroying angel

g4.definition: [ἀβαρής] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g922}}; weightless, i.e. (figuratively) not burdensome

g5.definition: [Ἀββᾶ] of Chaldee origin ({{h2}}); father as a vocative

g6.definition: [Ἄβελ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1893}}); Abel, the son of Adam

g7.definition: [Ἀβιά] of Hebrew origin ({{h29}}); Abijah, the name of two Israelites

g8.definition: [Ἀβιαθάρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h54}}); Abiathar, an Israelite

g9.definition: [Ἀβιληνή] of foreign origin (compare {{h58}}); Abilene, a region of Syria

g10.definition: [Ἀβιούδ] of Hebrew origin ({{h31}}); Abihud, an Israelite

g11.definition: [Ἀβραάμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h85}}); Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch (In Acts 7:16 the text should probably read Jacob.)

g12.definition: [ἄβυσσος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a variation of {{g1037}}; depthless, i.e. (specially) (infernal) "abyss"

g13.definition: [Ἄγαβος] of Hebrew origin (compare {{h2285}}); Agabus, an Israelite

g15.definition: [ἀγαθοποιέω] from {{g17}}; to be a well-doer (as a favor or a duty)

g17.definition: [ἀγαθοποιός] from {{g18}} and {{g4160}}; a well-doer, i.e. virtuous

g18.definition: [ἀγαθός] a primary word; "good" (in any sense, often as noun) Compare {{g2570}}.

g19.definition: [ἀγαθωσύνη] from {{g18}}; goodness, i.e. virtue or beneficence

g21.definition: [ἀγαλλιάω] from agan (much) and {{g242}}; properly, to jump for joy, i.e. exult

g22.definition: [ἄγαμος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g1062}}; unmarried

g23.definition: [ἀγανακτέω] from ἄγαν (much) and ἄχθος (grief; akin to the base of {{g43}}); to be greatly afflicted, i.e. (figuratively) indignant

g25.definition: [ἀγαπάω] perhaps from ἄγαν (much) (or compare {{h5689}}); to love (in a social or moral sense) Compare {{g5368}}.

g26.definition: [ἀγάπη] from {{g25}}; love, i.e. affection or benevolence; specially (plural) a love-feast

g28.definition: [Ἄγαρ] of Hebrew origin ({{h1904}}); Hagar, the concubine of Abraham

g29.definition: [ἀγγαρεύω] of foreign origin (compare {{h104}}); properly, to be a courier, i.e. (by implication) to press into public service

g30.definition: [ἀγγεῖον] from ἄγγος (a pail, perhaps as bent; compare the base of {{g43}}); a receptacle

g31.definition: [ἀγγελία] from {{g32}}; an announcement, i.e. (by implication) precept

g32.definition: [ἄγγελος] from ἀγγέλλω (probably derived from {{g71}}; compare {{g34}}) (to bring tidings); a messenger; especially an "angel"; by implication, a pastor

g33.definition: [ἄγε] imperative of {{g71}}; properly, lead, i.e. come on

g35.definition: [ἀγενεαλόγητος] from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g1075}}; unregistered as to birth

g36.definition: [ἀγενής] from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g1085}}; properly, without kin, i.e. (of unknown descent, and by implication) ignoble

g37.definition: [ἁγιάζω] from {{g40}}; to make holy, i.e. (ceremonially) purify or consecrate; (mentally) to venerate

g38.definition: [ἁγιασμός] from {{g37}}; properly, purification, i.e. (the state) purity; concretely (by Hebraism) a purifier

g39.definition: [ἅγιον] neuter of {{g40}}; a sacred thing (i.e. spot)

g40.definition: [ἅγιος] from ἅγος (an awful thing) (compare {{g53}}, {{g2282}}); sacred (physically, pure, morally blameless or religious, ceremonially, consecrated)

g43.definition: [ἀγκάλη] from ἄγκος (a bend, "ache"); an arm (as curved)

g44.definition: [ἄγκιστρον] from the same as {{g43}}; a hook (as bent)

g45.definition: [ἄγκυρα] from the same as {{g43}}; an "anchor" (as crooked)

g46.definition: [ἄγναφος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and the same as {{g1102}}; properly, unfulled, i.e. (by implication) new (cloth)

g48.definition: [ἁγνίζω] from {{g53}}; to make clean, i.e. (figuratively) sanctify (ceremonially or morally)

g49.definition: [ἁγνισμός] from {{g48}}; a cleansing (the act), i.e. (ceremonially) lustration

g50.definition: [ἀγνοέω] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g3539}}; not to know (through lack of information or intelligence); by implication, to ignore (through disinclination)

g51.definition: [ἀγνόημα] from {{g50}}; a thing ignored, i.e. shortcoming

g53.definition: [ἁγνός] from the same as {{g40}}; properly, clean, i.e. (figuratively) innocent, modest, perfect

g56.definition: [ἀγνωσία] from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g1108}}; ignorance (properly, the state)

g58.definition: [ἀγορά] from ἀγείρω (to gather; probably akin to {{g1453}}); properly, the town-square (as a place of public resort); by implication, a market or thoroughfare

g59.definition: [ἀγοράζω] from {{g58}}; properly, to go to market, i.e. (by implication) to purchase; specially, to redeem

g60.definition: [ἀγοραῖος] from {{g58}}; relating to the market-place, i.e. forensic (times); by implication, vulgar

g61.definition: [ἄγρα] from {{g71}}; (abstractly) a catching (of fish); also (concretely) a haul (of fish)

g62.definition: [ἀγράμματος] from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g1121}}; unlettered, i.e. illiterate

g63.definition: [ἀγραυλέω] from {{g68}} and {{g832}} (in the sense of {{g833}}); to camp out

g64.definition: [ἀγρεύω] from {{g61}}; to hunt, i.e. (figuratively) to entrap

g66.definition: [ἄγριος] from {{g68}}; wild (as pertaining to the country), literally (natural) or figuratively (fierce)

g67.definition: [Ἀγρίππας] apparently from {{g66}} and {{g2462}}; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods

g68.definition: [ἀγρός] from {{g71}}; a field (as a drive for cattle); genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. hamlet

g69.definition: [ἀγρυπνέω] ultimately from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g5258}}; to be sleepless, i.e. keep awake

g70.definition: [ἀγρυπνία] from {{g69}}; sleeplessness, i.e. a keeping awake

g71.definition: [ἄγω] a primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, (reflexively) go, (specially) pass (time), or (figuratively) induce

g72.definition: [ἀγωγή] reduplicated from {{g71}}; a bringing up, i.e. mode of living

g73.definition: [ἀγών] from {{g71}}; properly, a place of assembly (as if led), i.e. (by implication) a contest (held there); figuratively, an effort or anxiety

g74.definition: [ἀγωνία] from {{g73}}; a struggle (properly, the state), i.e. (figuratively) anguish

g75.definition: [ἀγωνίζομαι] from {{g73}}; to struggle, literally (to compete for a prize), figuratively (to contend with an adversary), or genitive case (to endeavor to accomplish something)

g76.definition: [Ἀδάμ] of Hebrew origin ({{h121}}); Adam, the first man; typically (of Jesus) man (as his representative)

g77.definition: [ἀδάπανος] from {{g1}} (as negative particle); and {{g1160}}; costless, i.e. gratuitous

g78.definition: [Ἀδδί] probably of Hebrew origin (compare {{h5716}}); Addi, an Israelite

g79.definition: [ἀδελφή] feminine of {{g80}}; a sister (naturally or ecclesiastically)

g80.definition: [ἀδελφός] from {{g1}} (as a connective particle) and δελφύς (the womb); a brother (literally or figuratively) near or remote (much like {{g1}})

g81.definition: [ἀδελφότης] from {{g80}}; brotherhood (properly, the feeling of brotherliness), i.e. the (Christian) fraternity

g82.definition: [ἄδηλος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g1212}}; hidden, figuratively, indistinct

g85.definition: [ἀδημονέω] from a derivative of ἀδέω (to be sated to loathing); to be in distress (of mind)

g86.definition: [ᾅδης] from {{g1}} (as negative particle) and {{g1492}}; properly, unseen, i.e. "Hades" or the place (state) of departed souls

g87.definition: [ἀδιάκριτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g1252}}; properly, undistinguished, i.e. (actively) impartial

g88.definition: [ἀδιάλειπτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of a compound of {{g1223}} and {{g3007}}; unintermitted, i.e. permanent

g89.definition: [ἀδιαλείπτως] adverb from {{g88}}; uninterruptedly, i.e. without omission (on an appropriate occasion)

g90.definition: [ἀδιαφθορία] from a derivative of a compound of {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g1311}}; incorruptibleness, i.e. (figuratively) purity (of doctrine)

g91.definition: [ἀδικέω] from {{g94}}; to be unjust, i.e. (actively) do wrong (morally, socially or physically)

g93.definition: [ἀδικία] from {{g94}}; (legal) injustice (properly, the quality, by implication, the act); morally, wrongfulness (of character, life or act)

g94.definition: [ἄδικος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g1349}}; unjust; by extension wicked; by implication, treacherous; specially, heathen

g96.definition: [ἀδόκιμος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g1384}}; unapproved, i.e. rejected; by implication, worthless (literally or morally)

g97.definition: [ἄδολος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle); and {{g1388}}; undeceitful, i.e. (figuratively) unadulterated

g98.definition: [Ἀδραμυττηνός] from Ἀδραμύττειον (a place in Asia Minor); Adramyttene or belonging to Adramyttium

g99.definition: [Ἀδρίας] from Ἀδρία (a place near its shore); the Adriatic sea (including the Ionian)
